maybe a midground can be a method to broadcast a list of arguments to each other? then this would change to torch.stack(torch.broadcast(a, b)) or torch.stack(torch.broadcast([a, b]))

(auto-broadcasting at its point was a mess with [1, N] * [N x 1] = [N x N], but I think now people got used to it; and lack of support is somewhat an inconsistency of its own, but it's a minor issue anyway)

body:
maybe a midground can be a method to broadcast a list of arguments to each other? then this would change to `torch.stack(torch.broadcast(a, b))` or `torch.stack(torch.broadcast([a, b]))`

(auto-broadcasting at its point was a mess with [1, N] * [N x 1] = [N x N], but I think now people got used to it; and lack of support is somewhat an inconsistency of its own, but it's a minor issue anyway)
